info.description: This is the BazaarVoice Conversations API. You can find out more about it at http://swagger.io. For this sample, you can use the api key "special-key" to test the authorization filters
info.title: BazaarVoice Conversations API

externalDocs.description: Find out more about the BazaarVoice Conversations API

get.description: Get Reviews for a given passKey

parameters.description: Version of API
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: Attributes to be included when returning content. For example, if includes are requested along with the &attributes=ModeratorCodes parameter, both the includes and the results will contain moderator codes. In order to filter by ModeratorCode, you must request the ModeratorCodes attribute parameter.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether to exclude content from other products in the same family as the requested product. For example, "&filter=productid:eq:1101&excludeFamily=true" limits returned content to just that of product 1101 and not any of the products in the same family. If a value is not defined, content on all products in the family will be returned.
parameters.name: ExcludeFamily

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: Filtering option for included nested content. TYPE can be any included nested content. i.e. Comments for Reviews.
parameters.name: Filter_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, or Questions).
parameters.name: Include

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Limit option for the nested content type returned. TYPE can be any nested content. i.e. Comments for Reviews. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 20.
parameters.name: Limit_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: Full-text search string used to find UGC. For more information about what fields are searched by default, see the Conversations API page. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search

parameters.description: Searching option for included content followed by full-text search string. See the Conversations API page for examples of searching for included data. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Sort criteria for primary content type of the query. Sort order is required (asc or desc). Multi-attribute sorting for each content/subject type is supported.
parameters.name: Sort

parameters.description: Sorting option for nested content. Sort order is required (asc or desc). TYPE can be any nested content. i.e. Comments for Reviews.
parameters.name: Sort_[TYPE]

parameters.description: The type of statistics that will be calculated on included subjects. Available content types are: Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories. Note: Not all statistical content types apply to every possible include.
parameters.name: Stats

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: The id of the product that this content is being submitted on.
parameters.name: ProductId

parameters.description: The submission action to take -- either 'Preview' or 'Submit'. 'Preview' will show a draft of the content to be submitted; 'Submit' will submit the content. Note that if Action=Submit, the request must be an HTTP POST.
parameters.name: Action

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'AdditionalField_Seat' with a value of '24F' (describing the seat number at a stadium or on a plane).
parameters.name: AdditionalField_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user agreed to the terms and conditions. Required depending on the client's settings.
parameters.name: AgreedToTermsAndConditions

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Arbitrary text that may be saved alongside content to indicate vehicle by which content was captured, e.g. "post-purchase email".
parameters.name: CampaignId

parameters.description:
Some examples of this parameter include the following. Each is followed by possible values.
  • ContextDataValue_PurchaserRank - "top", "top10", "top100", "top1000"
  • ContextDataValue_Purchaser - "yes", "no"
  • ContextDataValue_Age - "under21", "21to34", "35to44", "45to54", "55to64", "over65"
  • ContextDataValue_Gender - "male", "female"
parameters.name: ContextDataValue_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Fingerprint of content author's device. See the Authenticity Tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: fp

parameters.description: Email address where the submitter will receive the confirmation email. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the Authenticate User method for more information on hosted authentication.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_AuthenticationEmail

parameters.description: URL of the link contained in the user authentication email. This should point to a landing page where a web application exists to complete the user authentication process. The host for the URL must be one of the domains configured for the client. The link in the email will contain a user authentication token (authtoken) that is used to verify the submitter. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the hosted authentication tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_CallbackUrl

parameters.description: Value is true or false; default is null â€“ "true" or "false" answer to "I would recommend this to a friend". Required dependent on client settings.
parameters.name: IsRecommended

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Value is text representing a user comment to explain numerical Net Promoter score.
parameters.name: NetPromoterComment

parameters.description: Value is positive integer between 1 and 10 representing a numerical rating in response to "How would you rate this company?"
parameters.name: NetPromoterScore

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the photo URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: PhotoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is a Bazaarvoice URL of a photo uploaded using the Data API, where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: PhotoUrl_<n>

parameters.description: Value is non-negative integer representing the product external ID of the <n>'th product recommendation (for Social Recommendations)
parameters.name: ProductRecommendationId_<n>

parameters.description: Value is positive integer between 1 and 5, and represents review overall rating. Required depending on client settings.
parameters.name: Rating

parameters.description: A concrete example might be Rating_Quality where the value would represent the user's opinion of the quality of the product. The value is a positive integer between 1 and 5 and represents rating dimension value.
parameters.name: Rating_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Value is review body text.
parameters.name: ReviewText

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user wants to be notified when his/her content is published.
parameters.name: SendEmailAlertWhenPublished

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user wants to be notified when a comment is posted on the content.
parameters.name: SendEmailAlertWhenCommented

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'tag_Pro_1'. Valid values could be any free-form text. <n> should be a non-negative integer starting at the number 1.
parameters.name: tag_<Dimension-External-Id>_<n>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the tag applies to the user. A concrete example might be 'tagid_Pro/EasyToUse=true'.
parameters.name: tagid_<Dimension-External-Id>/<Tag-Label>

parameters.description: Value is content title text.
parameters.name: Title

parameters.description: Value of the encrypted user. This parameter demonstrates that a user has been authenticated. Note that the UserId parameter does not contain authentication information and should not be used for hosted authentication. See the Authenticate User method for more information.
parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's email address
parameters.name: UserEmail

parameters.description: User's external ID
parameters.name: UserId

parameters.description: User location text
parameters.name: UserLocation

parameters.description: User nickname display text
parameters.name: UserNickname

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the video URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: VideoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is valid YouTube or Bazaarvoice video-upload URL where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: VideoUrl_<n>

post.summary: Submit Review for a given Product

get.description: Returns stories. Note that stories can be posted on either a Product or a Category.

parameters.description: Version of API
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: Attributes to be included when returning content. For example, if includes are requested along with the &attributes=ModeratorCodes parameter, both the includes and the results will contain moderator codes. In order to filter by ModeratorCode, you must request the ModeratorCodes attribute parameter.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether to exclude content from other products in the same family as the requested product. For example, "&filter=productid:eq:1101&excludeFamily=true" limits returned content to just that of product 1101 and not any of the products in the same family. If a value is not defined, content on all products in the family will be returned.
parameters.name: ExcludeFamily

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: Filtering option for Comments if they are returned (see Include).
parameters.name: Filter_Comments

parameters.description: Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, or Questions).
parameters.name: Include
parameters.default: Returns only Stories if not specified

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Limit option for Comments if they are returned (see Include). Note that this limit doesn't apply to the entire set of comments returned, but to the comments for each individual story (CommentIds node). An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 20.
parameters.name: Limit_Comments

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: Full-text search string used to find UGC. For more information about what fields are searched by default, see the Conversations API page. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search

parameters.description: Searching option for included content followed by full-text search string. See the Conversations API page for examples of searching for included data. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Sort criteria for primary content type of the query. Sort order is required (asc or desc). Multi-attribute sorting for each content/subject type is supported.
parameters.name: Sort
parameters.default: Sorted by SubmissionTime if not specified

parameters.description: Sorting option for Comments if they are returned (see Include). Note that this sort order doesn't apply to the entire set of comments returned, but to the comments for each individual story (CommentIds node).
parameters.name: Sort_Comments

parameters.description: The type of statistics that will be calculated on included subjects. Available content types are: Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories. Note: Not all statistical content types apply to every possible include.
parameters.name: Stats

parameters.description: The text of the story
parameters.name: StoryText

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: The submission action to take -- either 'Preview' or 'Submit'. 'Preview' will show a draft of the content to be submitted; 'Submit' will submit the content. Note that if Action=Submit, the request must be an HTTP POST.
parameters.name: Action

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'AdditionalField_Seat' with a value of '24F' (describing the seat number at a stadium or on a plane).
parameters.name: AdditionalField_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user agreed to the terms and conditions. Required depending on the client's settings.
parameters.name: AgreedToTermsAndConditions

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Arbitrary text that may be saved alongside content to indicate vehicle by which content was captured, e.g. "post-purchase email".
parameters.name: CampaignId

parameters.description: The id of the category that this content is being submitted on. One of ProductId or CategoryId must be provided.
parameters.name: CategoryId

parameters.description:
Some examples of this parameter include the following. Each is followed by possible values.
  • ContextDataValue_PurchaserRank - "top", "top10", "top100", "top1000"
  • ContextDataValue_Purchaser - "yes", "no"
  • ContextDataValue_Age - "under21", "21to34", "35to44", "45to54", "55to64", "over65"
  • ContextDataValue_Gender - "male", "female"
parameters.name: ContextDataValue_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Fingerprint of content author's device. See the Authenticity Tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: fp

parameters.description: Email address where the submitter will receive the confirmation email. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the Authenticate User method for more information on hosted authentication.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_AuthenticationEmail

parameters.description: URL of the link contained in the user authentication email. This should point to a landing page where a web application exists to complete the user authentication process. The host for the URL must be one of the domains configured for the client. The link in the email will contain a user authentication token (authtoken) that is used to verify the submitter. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the hosted authentication tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_CallbackUrl

parameters.description: Boolean value. If IsUserAnonymous is true, the user's display name will not be shown with the question. This parameter is unrelated to UserId. This parameter can be turned off on a per client basis.
parameters.name: IsUserAnonymous

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the photo URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: PhotoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is a Bazaarvoice URL of a photo uploaded using the Data API, where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: PhotoUrl_<n>

parameters.description: Value is non-negative integer representing the product external ID of the <n>'th product recommendation (for Social Recommendations)
parameters.name: ProductRecommendationId_<n>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user wants to be notified when his/her content is published.
parameters.name: SendEmailAlertWhenPublished

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user wants to be notified when a comment is posted on the content.
parameters.name: SendEmailAlertWhenCommented

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'tag_Pro_1'. Valid values could be any free-form text. <n> should be a non-negative integer starting at the number 1.
parameters.name: tag_<Dimension-External-Id>_<n>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the tag applies to the user. A concrete example might be 'tagid_Pro/EasyToUse=true'.
parameters.name: tagid_<Dimension-External-Id>/<Tag-Label>

parameters.description: Value is content title text.
parameters.name: Title

parameters.description: Value of the encrypted user. This parameter demonstrates that a user has been authenticated. Note that the UserId parameter does not contain authentication information and should not be used for hosted authentication. See the Authenticate User method for more information.
parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's email address
parameters.name: UserEmail

parameters.description: User's external ID
parameters.name: UserId

parameters.description: User location text
parameters.name: UserLocation

parameters.description: User nickname display text
parameters.name: UserNickname

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the video URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: VideoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is valid YouTube or Bazaarvoice video-upload URL where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: VideoUrl_<n>

post.summary: Submit stories on a product or a category.

get.description: Returns Questions along with nested content like Answers and related subjects like Product/Category.

parameters.description: Version of API
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: Attributes to be included when returning content. For example, if includes are requested along with the &attributes=ModeratorCodes parameter, both the includes and the results will contain moderator codes. In order to filter by ModeratorCode, you must request the ModeratorCodes attribute parameter.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether to exclude content from other products in the same family as the requested product. For example, "&filter=productid:eq:1101&excludeFamily=true" limits returned content to just that of product 1101 and not any of the products in the same family. If a value is not defined, content on all products in the family will be returned.
parameters.name: ExcludeFamily

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: Filtering option for included nested content. TYPE can be any included nested content. e.g. Answers for Questions.
parameters.name: Filter_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, or Questions).
parameters.name: Include
parameters.default: Returns only Questions if not specified

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Limit option for the nested content type returned. TYPE can be any nested content. e.g. Answers for Questions. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 20.
parameters.name: Limit_TYPE

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: Full-text search string used to find UGC. For more information about what fields are searched by default, see the Conversations API page. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search

parameters.description: Searching option for included content followed by full-text search string. See the Conversations API page for examples of searching for included data. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Sort criteria for primary content type of the query. Sort order is required (asc or desc). Multi-attribute sorting for each content/subject type is supported.
parameters.name: Sort

parameters.description: Sorting option for nested content. TYPE can be any nested content. e.g. Answers for Questions.
parameters.name: Sort_[TYPE]

parameters.description: The type of statistics that will be calculated on included subjects. Available content types are: Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories. Note: Not all statistical content types apply to every possible include.
parameters.name: Stats

post.description: Submit questions on a product or category.

parameters.description: Contains the text of the question summary. Only a single line of text is allowed.
parameters.name: QuestionSummary

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: The submission action to take -- either 'Preview' or 'Submit'. 'Preview' will show a draft of the content to be submitted; 'Submit' will submit the content. Note that if Action=Submit, the request must be an HTTP POST.
parameters.name: Action

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'AdditionalField_Seat' with a value of '24F' (describing the seat number at a stadium or on a plane).
parameters.name: AdditionalField_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user agreed to the terms and conditions. Required depending on the client's settings.
parameters.name: AgreedToTermsAndConditions

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Arbitrary text that may be saved alongside content to indicate vehicle by which content was captured, e.g. "post-purchase email".
parameters.name: CampaignId

parameters.description: The id of the category that this content is being submitted on. One of ProductId or CategoryId must be provided.
parameters.name: CategoryId

parameters.description:
Some examples of this parameter include the following. Each is followed by possible values.
  • ContextDataValue_PurchaserRank - "top", "top10", "top100", "top1000"
  • ContextDataValue_Purchaser - "yes", "no"
  • ContextDataValue_Age - "under21", "21to34", "35to44", "45to54", "55to64", "over65"
  • ContextDataValue_Gender - "male", "female"
parameters.name: ContextDataValue_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Fingerprint of content author's device. See the Authenticity Tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: fp

parameters.description: Email address where the submitter will receive the confirmation email. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the Authenticate User method for more information on hosted authentication.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_AuthenticationEmail

parameters.description: URL of the link contained in the user authentication email. This should point to a landing page where a web application exists to complete the user authentication process. The host for the URL must be one of the domains configured for the client. The link in the email will contain a user authentication token (authtoken) that is used to verify the submitter. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the hosted authentication tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_CallbackUrl

parameters.description: Boolean value. If IsUserAnonymous is true, the user's display name will not be shown with the question. This parameter is unrelated to UserId. This parameter can be turned off on a per client basis.
parameters.name: IsUserAnonymous

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the photo URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: PhotoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is a Bazaarvoice URL of a photo uploaded using the Data API, where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: PhotoUrl_<n>

parameters.description: The id of the product that this content is being submitted on. One of ProductId or CategoryId must be provided.
parameters.name: ProductId

parameters.description: Value is non-negative integer representing the product external ID of the <n>'th product recommendation (for Social Recommendations)
parameters.name: ProductRecommendationId_<n>

parameters.description: Contains the text of the question details. Multiple lines of text are allowed.
parameters.name: QuestionDetails

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user wants to be notified when his/her content is published.
parameters.name: SendEmailAlertWhenPublished

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'tag_Pro_1'. Valid values could be any free-form text. <n> should be a non-negative integer starting at the number 1.
parameters.name: tag_<Dimension-External-Id>_<n>

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the tag applies to the user. A concrete example might be 'tagid_Pro/EasyToUse=true'.
parameters.name: tagid_<Dimension-External-Id>/<Tag-Label>

parameters.description: Value of the encrypted user. This parameter demonstrates that a user has been authenticated. Note that the UserId parameter does not contain authentication information and should not be used for hosted authentication. See the Authenticate User method for more information.
parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's email address
parameters.name: UserEmail

parameters.description: User's external ID
parameters.name: UserId

parameters.description: User location text
parameters.name: UserLocation

parameters.description: User nickname display text
parameters.name: UserNickname

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the video URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: VideoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is valid YouTube or Bazaarvoice video-upload URL where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: VideoUrl_<n>

post.summary: Submit questions on a product or category.

parameters.description: Version of API
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: Value of the type of thank you page serving the related questions. Supported values include "Review" or "Answer" only.
parameters.name: ContentType

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: The id of the category for which you want to find related questions. Either ProductId or CategoryId must be provided.
parameters.name: CategoryId

parameters.description: Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, or Questions).
parameters.name: Include
parameters.default: Will only return Questions if not specified

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: The id of the product that this content is being submitted on. One of ProductId or CategoryId must be provided.
parameters.name: ProductId

parameters.description: Question ID to ignore (e.g., if you are already looking at that question and don't want it to display as a related question)
parameters.name: QuestionId

parameters.description: Comma-separated list of related product IDs. No initial existence checking is done on the RelatedProducts parameter. If you pass in a ProductId that doesn't exist, it gets ignored silently.
parameters.name: RelatedProducts

parameters.description: Value of the encrypted user. This parameter demonstrates that a user has been authenticated. Note that the UserId parameter does not contain authentication information and should not be used for hosted authentication. See the Authenticate User method for more information.
parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's external ID. May not be used if User parameter is present.
parameters.name: UserId

get.description: Returns comments posted on reviews or stories.

parameters.description: Version of API
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: Attributes to be included when returning content. For example, if includes are requested along with the &attributes=ModeratorCodes parameter, both the includes and the results will contain moderator codes. In order to filter by ModeratorCode, you must request the ModeratorCodes attribute parameter.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether to exclude content from other products in the same family as the requested product. For example, "&filter=productid:eq:1101&excludeFamily=true" limits returned content to just that of product 1101 and not any of the products in the same family. If a value is not defined, content on all products in the family will be returned.
parameters.name: ExcludeFamily

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, or Questions).
parameters.name: Include
parameters.default: Returns only Comments if not specified

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: Full-text search string used to find UGC. For more information about what fields are searched by default, see the Conversations API page. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search

parameters.description: Searching option for included content followed by full-text search string. See the Conversations API page for examples of searching for included data. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Sort criteria for primary content type of the query. Sort order is required (asc or desc). Multi-attribute sorting for each content/subject type is supported.
parameters.name: Sort

parameters.description: The type of statistics that will be calculated on included subjects. Available content types are: Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories. Note: Not all statistical content types apply to every possible include.
parameters.name: Stats

get.summary: Returns comments posted on reviews or stories.

post.description: Submit a comment on a review or a story..

parameters.description: Contains the text of the comment.
parameters.name: CommentText

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: [FORMAT]

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Arbitrary text that may be saved alongside content to indicate vehicle by which content was captured, e.g. "post-purchase email".
parameters.name: CampaignId

parameters.description:
Some examples of this parameter include the following. Each is followed by possible values.
  • ContextDataValue_PurchaserRank - "top", "top10", "top100", "top1000"
  • ContextDataValue_Purchaser - "yes", "no"
  • ContextDataValue_Age - "under21", "21to34", "35to44", "45to54", "55to64", "over65"
  • ContextDataValue_Gender - "male", "female"
parameters.name: ContextDataValue_<Dimension-External-Id>

parameters.description: Fingerprint of content author's device. See the Authenticity Tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: fp

parameters.description: Email address where the submitter will receive the confirmation email. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the Authenticate User method for more information on hosted authentication.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_AuthenticationEmail

parameters.description: URL of the link contained in the user authentication email. This should point to a landing page where a web application exists to complete the user authentication process. The host for the URL must be one of the domains configured for the client. The link in the email will contain a user authentication token (authtoken) that is used to verify the submitter. If you are configured to use hosted email authentication, this parameter is required. See the hosted authentication tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: HostedAuthentication_CallbackUrl

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the photo URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: PhotoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is a Bazaarvoice URL of a photo uploaded using the Data API, where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: PhotoUrl_<n>

parameters.description: Value is non-negative integer representing the product external ID of the <n>'th product recommendation (for Social Recommendations)
parameters.name: ProductRecommendationId_<n>

parameters.description: The id of the review that this comment is being submitted on. One ReviewId or StoryId is required.
parameters.name: ReviewId

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user wants to be notified when his/her content is published.
parameters.name: SendEmailAlertWhenPublished

parameters.description: The id of the story that this comment is being submitted on. One ReviewId or StoryId is required.
parameters.name: StoryId

parameters.description: Value is content title text.
parameters.name: Title

parameters.description: Value of the encrypted user. This parameter demonstrates that a user has been authenticated. Note that the UserId parameter does not contain authentication information and should not be used for hosted authentication. See the Authenticate User method for more information.
parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's email address
parameters.name: UserEmail

parameters.description: User's external ID
parameters.name: UserId

parameters.description: User location text
parameters.name: UserLocation

parameters.description: User nickname display text
parameters.name: UserNickname

parameters.description: Value is caption text for the video URL with the same value of <n>.
parameters.name: VideoCaption_<n>

parameters.description: Value is valid YouTube or Bazaarvoice video-upload URL where <n> is a non-negative integer.
parameters.name: VideoUrl_<n>

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.

parameters.description: The id of the question that this answer is being submitted on.

parameters.description: The submission action to take -- either 'Preview' or 'Submit'. 'Preview' will show a draft of the content to be submitted; 'Submit' will submit the content. Note that if Action=Submit, the request must be an HTTP POST.

parameters.description: A concrete example of the parameter might be 'AdditionalField_Seat' with a value of '24F' (describing the seat number at a stadium or on a plane).

parameters.description: Boolean indicating whether or not the user agreed to the terms and conditions. Required depending on the client's settings.

parameters.description: Attributes to be included when returning content. For example, if includes are requested along with the &attributes=ModeratorCodes parameter, both the includes and the results will contain moderator codes. In order to filter by ModeratorCode, you must request the ModeratorCodes attribute parameter.
parameters.name: Attributes

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: Filter criteria for a included content or subject type. TYPE can be Reviews, Questions, Answers, or Comments. Multiple filter criteria are supported for each content type.
parameters.name: Filter_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Content types written by the author to be included (e.g. Questions, Reviews, Answers, or Comments). Subject types like Products and Categories can also be specified.
parameters.name: Include

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Limit option for a included content. TYPE can be Reviews, Questions, Answers or Comments. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 20.
parameters.name: Limit_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.

parameters.description: Sort criteria for primary content type of the query. Sort order is required (asc or desc). Multi-attribute sorting for each content/subject type is supported.
parameters.name: Sort

parameters.description: Sort criteria for a included content. TYPE can be Reviews, Questions, Answers or Comments.
parameters.name: Sort_[TYPE]

parameters.description: The content types for which statistics should be calculated for the author. Available content types are: Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories. Note: Statistics can also be calculated on includes.
parameters.name: Stats

post.description: Upload photos for a review, question, answer, story or comment.

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: Format

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: The content type for which this media is being submitted. Valid values include: review, question, answer, story, review_comment and story_comment.
parameters.name: ContentType

parameters.description: A file representing the photo to be submitted. Note that the parameter name is case-sensitive and must be lowercase. Use either the photo or photoUrl parameter to define the photo to upload. An error is returned if both parameters are defined.
parameters.name: Photo

parameters.description: URL of the photo to be uploaded. Use either the photo or photoUrl parameter to define the photo to upload. An error is returned if both parameters are defined. HTTP and HTTPS are the only protocols supported for the photoUrl parameter.
parameters.name: PhotoURL

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Value of the encrypted user. This parameter demonstrates that a user has been authenticated. Note that the UserId parameter does not contain authentication information and should not be used for hosted authentication. See the Authenticate User method for more information.
parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's external ID
parameters.name: UserId

post.summary: Upload photos for a review, question, answer, story or comment.

parameters.name: User

parameters.description: User's external ID
parameters.name: UserId

post.summary: Upload videos for a review, question, answer, story or comment.

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: Format

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Boolean flag indicating whether to exclude content (reviews, questions, etc.) from other products in the same family as the requested product. This setting only affects any nested content that is returned. For example, '&filter=productid:eq:1101&include=reviews&excludeFamily=true' limits returned review content to just that of product 1101 and not any of the products in the same family. If a value is not defined, content on all products in the family is returned.
parameters.name: ExcludeFamily

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: Filtering option for included nested content. TYPE can be any related content, i.e., Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories, Comments, Authors, Categories.
parameters.name: Filter_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Related subjects to be included (e.g. Products, Categories, Authors, Reviews, Questions, or Stories).
parameters.name: Include

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Limit option for the nested content type returned. TYPE can be any related content i.e.Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories, Comments, Authors, Categories. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 20.
parameters.name: Limit_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: Full-text search string used to find UGC. For more information about what fields are searched by default, see the Conversations API page. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search

parameters.description: Searching option for included content followed by full-text search string. See the Conversations API page for examples of searching for included data. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Sort criteria for primary content type of the query. Sort order is required (asc or desc). Multi-attribute sorting for each content/subject type is supported.
parameters.name: Sort

parameters.description: Sorting option for nested content. Sort order is required (asc or desc). TYPE can be any related content, i.e., Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories, Comments, Authors, Categories.
parameters.name: Sort_[TYPE]

parameters.description: The content types for which statistics should be calculated for the product. Available content types are: Reviews, Questions, Answers, Stories. Note: Statistics can also be calculated on includes.
parameters.name: Stats

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: Format

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma). See Cross Domain Requests Using JSONP for more information.
parameters.name: Callback

parameters.description: Filter criteria for primary content of the query. Multiple filter criteria are supported.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.name: Include

parameters.description: Max number of records returned. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 100.
parameters.name: Limit

parameters.description: Limit option for the nested content type returned. TYPE can be any nested content. e.g. Answers for Questions. An error is returned if the value passed exceeds 20.
parameters.name: Limit_TYPE

parameters.description: Locale to display Labels, Configuration, Product Attributes and Category Attributes in. The default value is the locale defined in the display associated with the API key.
parameters.name: Locale

parameters.description: Index at which to return results. By default, indexing begins at 0 when you issue a query. Using Limit=100, Offset=0 returns results 0-99. When changing this to Offset=1, results 1-100 are returned.
parameters.name: Offset

parameters.description: Full-text search string used to find UGC. For more information about what fields are searched by default, see the Conversations API page. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search

parameters.description: Searching option for included content followed by full-text search string. See the Conversations API page for examples of searching for included data. Note: This invalidates sort options due to the fact that search takes precedence in returned data.
parameters.name: Search_[TYPE]

parameters.description: Sort criteria for Categories. Multi-attribute sorting is supported.
parameters.name: Sort

parameters.description: The content types for which statistics can be calculated for the category. Available content types are: Stories, Questions, Answers. Note: Statistics can also be calculated on includes.
parameters.name: Stats

get.description: Returns Product-based Review Statistics. This method has been optimized and was created for inline ratings display.

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: Filter criteria for content of the query. Must be Product IDs.
parameters.name: Filter

parameters.description: The content type for which statistics should be included. Currently available types: Reviews
parameters.name: Stats

parameters.description: Callback function name used with JSONP. Value is a string consisting of the following characters: a-z,A-Z,0-9,_ (excluding comma).
parameters.name: Callback

get.summary: Returns Product-based Review Statistics. This method has been optimized and was created for inline ratings display.

post.description: Submit feedback on a review, question, answer, story, review comment, or story comment.

parameters.description: The media-type type of the request body. Value must be application/x-www-form-urlencoded.
parameters.name: Content-Type

parameters.description: IP address of content author. See Authenticity Tutorial for more information.
parameters.name: X-Forwarded-For

parameters.description: The API version, e.g. 5.4.
parameters.name: ApiVersion

parameters.description: ID of the content with which the feedback is associated
parameters.name: ContentId

parameters.description: Type of content with which the feedback is associated (review, story, question, answer, story_comment, review_comment)
parameters.name: ContentType

parameters.description: Type of feedback (inappropriate, helpfulness)
parameters.name: FeedbackType

parameters.description: Response format (xml or json)
parameters.name: FORMAT

parameters.description: API key is required to authenticate API user and check permission to access particular client's data.
parameters.name: PassKey

parameters.description: Helpfulness vote for this content. Valid votes are: Positive, Negative, UNDO. This parameter is only required for FeedbackType=helpfulness.
parameters.name: Vote

parameters.description: User's external ID. May be required for Positive, Negative and Inappropriate depending on configuration. Always required for UNDO.
parameters.name: UserId

parameters.description: Reason this content has been flagged as inappropriate
parameters.name: ReasonText

post.summary: Submit feedback on a review, question, answer, story, review comment, or story comment.
